issues.title: Links must have discernible text

aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty

issues.title: Links do not have a discernible name
issues.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn how to make links accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-name).

issues.title: Select element must have an accessible name
issues.description: Ensure select element has an accessible name

any.message: Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
Element does not have an explicit <label>
aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
Element has no title attribute
Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: This select element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description:
<select>
                    <option>US...</select>

original_issue.message: This select element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div > div:nth-child(3) > select

issues.title: Select elements do not have associated label elements.
issues.description: Form elements without effective labels can create frustrating experiences for screen reader users. [Learn more about the `select` element](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/select-name).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description:
<select>
                    <option>US...</select>

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div > div:nth-child(3) > select

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input type="text" id="search" placeholder="Search...">

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description: <input type="text" id="search" placeholder="Search...">

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.

issues.title: This emailinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input type="email" placeholder="type your email...">

original_issue.message: This emailinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > main > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(4) > input
